title: Isabella I of Castile
summary: Isabella I (Spanish: Isabel I, 22 April 1451 â€“ 26 November 1504)[2] was Queen of Castile from 1474 until she died in 1504, reigning over a dynastically unified Spain jointly with her husband, King Ferdinand II of Aragon. She was Queen of Aragon after Ferdinand ascended in 1479. Together they are known as the Catholic Monarchs.[3]
